instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SYS_ONEWIRE: What is SYS_ONEWIRE? This is a bidirectional communication line between the system management controller(SMC) and the charger that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC. This must be working for the light to come on on the magsafe charger. .
definitions.ADAPTOR_SENSE: What is ADAPTOR_SENSE? This is a typo of ADAPTER_SENSE When you see ADAPTOR_SENSE, assume they meant to type ADAPTER_SENSE.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.CPU_VCORE: What is CPU_VCORE? Power rail for the CPU. If this is missing the machine will act braindead. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light, im a little confused , i have ppbus g3 and pp3v42, at <CHIP>U6900</CHIP> pin 1 (<SIGNAL>SM_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL>) i have 3.4v pin 5 (<SIGNAL>ADAPTOR_SENSE</SIGNAL>) i have 5.15v, at pin 4 (<SIGNAL>SYS_ONEWIRE</SIGNAL>) i have 3.4V but no green light ?, forgot to say no signs of any liquid damage anyway

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message: Voltage on PPBUS? Tried known good DC in board? Trackpad, keyboard, and all the internals unplugged?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message: 5V at adapter sense is a problem. Usually a bad magsafe board or crap under J6900.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message: ok thats wierd, the magsafe shows a green light on another board , but changed i anyway for a new one and guess what i have 2.9v at adaptor sense, but still no green light ,the other voltages are as before

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message: Please answer every question! Voltage at <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message: Also these need to show an orange light after 2-3 seconds of green!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message: Hi , voltage at <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 11.96v , sorry what i meant about the dc in board was it seamed to work worked in another board

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message: Is that with just the board and MagSafe plugged in? Because if so that’s way too low. SMC suspect

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message: 11.96V is with battery connected....must measure without! And I ask again, does the light turn orange?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message: Hi, no the battery is not connected , the board is out of the laptop and i dont get any light at all. If 11.96V is low what should the voltage there

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message: If you don’t get a light...using known good MagSafe board? PP3v42 present? PPBUS should be 12.56 volts which makes the SMC suspect.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message: Hi thanks , yes dc in board ive tried 3 new ones , will try changing the smc, does the smc have to be from an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> or could i use one from a similar board ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message:
The SMC may not be the problem answer the questions in this order.....

1. Is PP3v42 present?
2. If it is, what is the resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>
3. What is your voltage on <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>?
4. Does the SMC area look like it has had liquid damage (obvious corrosion, red probe points)?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message:
Hi
pp3v42 = 3.4v
resistance between 17/18 is 4.1 and 27/28 is 20.6
voltage on <SIGNAL>SMC_REST_L</SIGNAL> = 3.34v
board looks completely clean all over

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message: 11.9V should be 12.56 or 12.3 at least. Is ACOK present? Did you check PPBUS on the fuse?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message: Hi yes ACOK is 3.2V at pin 14 <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>, dc in fuse is 20v , <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> at fuse f7040 / f7041 has now changed to 5.3v which was 11.96v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message: Hi , yes ACOK is 3.2v at pin 14 <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>, dc in fuse f6905 is 20v and ppbus at f7040 / f7041 which was 11.9v has now dropped to 5.3v ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message: <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> could be bad. Also check the resistance between 17/18 and 27/28 again and also check voltage at DCIN pin.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message: looks like <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> went bad , now have green light , but now have 12.26V at ppbus f7040 / f7041, dc in fuse is still 20v, is 12.56v at ppbus now pointing to smc ??

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message: 12.26v at <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is too low. When the SMC communicates with the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> will be 12.56v. Is <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> 3.4v?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message: Green light should also turn orange after 2 seconds, does it do that?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message: ok , i lost green light all together and developed a short on pp3v42 so i injected 3.4v into the line and the smc started to get hot, changed the smc and now i have green light back that now turns to orange after a few seconds and the fans spin up for a second then turn off and spin up again , <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is 3.2v if thats still any relevance

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message:
Could be anything. You also need to wonder how the SMC died. Probably voltage spike on 3v42 from you shorting something out. Damage could be extensive now on the 3V42 rail too.

Is CPU Vcore coming on? PPBUS stable at 12.6V?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message: <SIGNAL>CPU_VCORE</SIGNAL> isnt coming on , PPBUS is steady at 12.48V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message: 12.48 is not a normal voltage. It should either be 12.56 or 12.3. But not that important right now as it should turn on with 12.48. CPU Vcore not coming up can be absolutely anything. I suspect 3V42 went high and everything on that rail could be bad. Clock chip is the first suspect that could also affect CPU Vcore.
